charge_type.source: one count of trafficking in dangerous drugs

drugs.source: 4 re-sealable plastic bags containing totally 17.0 grammes of “Ice”;
3 plastic bags containing 14.4 grammes of herbal cannabis were also found inside a pouch on a bedside desk

roles.source: identifying the applicant’s role as a “storekeeper”;

aggravating_factors.source: trafficking in more than one type of drug was an aggravating factor, the judge enhanced the starting point by 1 month
the judge further found the applicant to be a persistent offender, for which he enhanced the sentence by a further 6 months

guilty_plea.source: he would plead guilty shortly after trial dates were fixed in the High Court. On 22 January 2025, he was sentenced ... The defendant did plead guilty on 22 January 2025, admitted to the summary of facts, and was duly convicted.

starting_point.source: adopted a starting point of 7½ years’ imprisonment for trafficking in 17.0 grammes of “Ice”

sentence_after_role.source: based on the summary of facts, the only reasonable inference is that the defendant was in possession of the dangerous drugs as a storekeeper, and he is to be sentenced as such. I adopt a starting point of 7 years and 6 months

notional_sentence.source: I will enhance his sentence by 6 months on him being a persistent offender, taking the starting point up to 8 years’ imprisonment. Furthermore ... I will enhance his sentence on this basis by 1 month, taking the total to 8 years and 1 month.

final_sentence.source: the applicant was given a discount of about 25% for his late plea ... resulting in a sentence of 6 years and 1 month’s imprisonment. (CFI: resulting in a post discount sentence of 73 months’ imprisonment.)
